item.title: Pokemon Fan Creates Regional Variant and Evolution for Torkoal
item.description:
Highlights

  • Torkoal gets a fresh makeover as a hot spring Pokemon, sparking fan excitement for new regional variants and evolutions in the series.
  • Fans praise the unique Torkoal variant, offering creative ideas for its evolution and potential in the Pokemon world as Dude0720 makes a splash with their first design.
  • Despite Torkoal being neglected for updates, its dedicated fanbase hopes for Game Freak to consider giving the Coal Pokemon some new forms in the future.

A Pokemon fan has shared a unique regional variant for Torkoal, as well as an evolution for it. The interesting Pokemon regional design would change the Pokemon's typing to Fire/Water or Water/Rock, according to the artist.

Pokemon regional variants offer fans an exciting alternate take on existing and loved Pokemon designs. While some Pokemon regional variants are better received than others, the concept provided a neat way to refresh older Pokemon without radically changing their existing evolutionary lines. However, there's less than 60 regional forms available in the games at this time, so fans often step up and share new concepts that could fit those who don't have one yet.

Related
New Switch 2 Leak Is Good News For Pokemon Fans
A well-known leaker shares some good news for Pokemon fans eager to play new entries in the franchise on Nintendo's next console.

Such is the case with Dude0720, who shared their unique form for Torkoal . Torkoal's usual coal-infused concept is instead replaced with a hot spring, with steam from water emerging from it instead of the usual coal smoke. Torkoal is wearing a pair of towels and looks quite content. The Torkoal regional form can evolve into a Pokemon the artist has called Toruana. Toruana is significantly bigger than its predecessor, and the hot spring has opened up into one continuous pool, looking inviting for Pokemon or people to rest in. Both Torkoal and Toruana also have markings on their legs to make it look like they're wearing flip-flops.

Pokemon fans have been extremely receptive to the concepts, especially since this is Dude0720's first regional variant design. Pokemon fans were quick to offer ideas for its Pokedex entry and how it might be utilized in the Pokemon world. One fan imagined that Torkoal would evolve into Toruana when the small holes in its shell further fractured, causing a large opening to form in the shell. Another suggested the idea of going on a Pokemon Safari tour while resting in the hot spring on Toruana's back, providing a relaxing and exciting experience all at once. Additional names were also offered for the evolution, like Tortuzzi, referencing Jacuzzi hot tubs.

Torkoal Has Been Largely Ignored

Torkoal has been around in the Pokemon series for quite some time, originating way back in Pokemon 's Gen 3 . However, the Pokemon hasn't really seen any significant alterations or additions since then. It lacks any evolutions, regional forms, or special temporary evolutions like Mega Evolutions or Gigantamax. It remains to be seen if Game Freak ever amends this, but it looks like there are enough fans of the Coal Pokemon that it would be a wise idea for the developer to consider it.

item.title: June 10 Will Be a Big Day for Assassin's Creed Red Fans
item.description:
Highlights

  • Assassin's Creed Red gameplay will reportedly debut at 2024 Ubisoft Forward, hinting at a release in FY2025.
  • Assassin's Creed Red will explore feudal Japan, shaking up the series with new gameplay elements and dual protagonists.
  • Ubisoft plans to launch Assassin's Creed Infinity as a central hub for the entire series.

A reputable report has confirmed that gameplay of Assassin's Creed Red will officially debut at the 2024 Ubisoft Forward. The upcoming mainline Assassin's Creed title is set to be released in fiscal year 2025, which extends from April 2024 to March 2025, so an official introduction at Ubisoft's large-scale summer event seems likely.

The Assassin's Creed franchise has been a source of success for Ubisoft. Since the launch of Assassin's Creed Valhalla in 2020 and Assassin's Creed Mirage in 2023, fans have been eagerly awaiting news of the next mainline entry. Ubisoft answered their requests by announcing Assassin's Creed: Codename Red at the 2022 Ubisoft Forward, which will take the series to the highly-requested lands of feudal Japan. The company went silent on the game, up until its third-quarter 2024 sales report was issued earlier this year, which mentioned Ubisoft's plans to release Assassin's Creed Red in FY2025 .

Related
Assassin's Creed Red Could Be a Leap of Faith for the Franchise's Future
If rumors are true, Assassin's Creed Red is both a swan song to the Origins formula and an introduction to a new era of the franchise.

Insider Gaming recently published a report confirming that the official gameplay reveal of Assassin's Creed Red will be featured in this summer's Ubisoft Forward, which is slated for June 10. Fans can likely expect a cinematic trailer revealing Assassin's Creed Red 's official title , and a tentative release window alongside it. The leak also asserts that content creators and media outlets will get some hands-on time with the game during the week of Summer Games Fest, the preview embargo for which will lift on June 12.

Assassin's Creed Red Will Kick Off an Important Era for the Series

Ubisoft will also reportedly use Red as a springboard for the launch of Assassin's Creed Infinity , a central hub for the Assassin's Creed universe. Assassin's Creed Infinity will apparently house the modern-day story arc connecting the various entries in the franchise. To enable this, the entire series will transition to a unified engine dubbed the Anvil Pipeline. This will help streamline development and also unlock graphical upsides such as ray-traced global illumination. However, shifting to the Anvil Pipeline has allegedly required a complete revamp of various technical aspects like animations, parkour systems, dynamic weather, etc.

Insider Gaming's track record is near-flawless, which spells great news for those clamoring for more details about the upcoming Assassin's Creed title. Some gameplay details for Assassin's Creed Red were also leaked a while back, claiming an overhauled parkour system, a stealth focus, and gore-heavy combat that echoes Assassin's Creed Valhalla . Moreover, Red will break the series' usual one-protagonist mold by introducing dual playable characters, both embodying real historical figures: the renowned African samurai Yasuke, and a female Assassin named Naoe. With just over a month to go, the June Ubisoft Forward is shaping up to be a must-watch.

item.title: Diablo Immortal Reveals New Class
item.description:
Highlights

  • Diablo Immortal introduces the new Tempest class on May 23rd, adding unique elemental powers to the game.
  • Players can choose from seven classes in Diablo Immortal, each offering different gameplay styles and abilities.
  • The addition of the Tempest class brings a fresh warrior character with water and wind abilities to protect Sanctuary.

Diablo Immortal has released a trailer to reveal the new Tempest class, which will arrive in the game on May 23. Like the other Diablo games, Diablo Immortal players must choose a class to create a character and face the dangers of Sanctuary. Each Diablo Immortal class offers a gameplay style based on different weapons and skills.

Seven classes are available to Diablo Immortal players, these being the Blood Knight, Barbarian Crusader, Demon Hunter, Monk, Necromancer, and Wizard. For Diablo Immortal players who prefer melee combat, the options are Barbarian, Crusader, and Monk. Meanwhile, Demon Hunter and Wizard are the ranged classes, and Necromancer is the Diablo Immortal class that, like other titles in the franchise, is based on summons. Diablo Immortal players have a very familiar selection of classes, especially for veteran fans. Now, that list will grow with the debut of a new warrior to protect Sanctuary in Diablo Immortal .

Related
Devs Discuss Diablo Immortal's New Stance System
Game Rant sits down with Diablo Immortal developers to talk about the new stance system arriving with the Blood Knight update.

Diablo Immortal announced the new Tempest class that will be available to players on May 23. In the trailer, Diablo Immortal shows a burning boat with people trapped inside it and about to be attacked by demons. It's then that the Tempests appear, defeating the demons and saving the people. The Tempest is the newest class since Diablo Immortal added the Blood Knight last year, bringing back for fans one of the enemies seen in the first Diablo game.

Diablo Immortal's New Class is a Warrior with Elemental Powers

The Tempest is a warrior who wields dual blades and harnesses the elemental powers of water and wind to face Diablo Immortal 's enemies . The second part of the trailer gives players a sneak peek at what the Tempest's gameplay will be like by showing the new class using water abilities to move and unleash powerful attacks. According to a post on Blizzard's official blog, Diablo Immortal 's new class is a "mysterious wanderer who has emerged from the frigid mists of the North to push back the darkness." The post also promises a deep dive into the Tempest's abilities and a short story from senior narrative designer Ryan Quinn.

The Tempest will arrive in Diablo Immortal as part of a free update that will add a new quest specifically for the class. Players who want to test out the Tempest's powers will be able to do so by using Diablo Immortal 's class change feature and converting one of their existing characters. As for what's to come for Diablo Immortal , Blizzard revealed in March an exciting roadmap called "The Year of Unmaking," which will eventually bring Diablo himself to fight players.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail Leaks New Mode With Free Character Reward
item.description:
Highlights

  • Update 2.3 of Honkai: Star Rail will bring the challenging Apocalyptic Shadow mode with unique rewards and gameplay restrictions.
  • Players will face multiple bosses and enemies in the Apocalyptic Shadow mode to earn Stellar Jades and the Quantum unit Xueyi.
  • Version 2.3 will introduce new events, modes, and units, expanding gameplay options and providing generous rewards for players.

A Honkai: Star Rail leak has revealed fresh details about the Apocalyptic Shadow mode, which will reportedly be released in update 2.3. Several leaks regarding Honkai: Star Rail 's update 2.3 have recently emerged online, giving players an insight into the upcoming content. The game's next version is rumored to bring new planar ornaments, relics, and a PvP event in which players must take on each other to claim generous rewards.

Honkai: Star Rail features several combat modes, such as Pure Fiction, Simulated Universe, and Memory of Chaos, that consist of stages and pit Trailblazers against a roster of enemies. These endgame activities provide ascension materials, Stellar Jades, relics, and more unique rewards. In every update, they make several changes to their enemy lineups to offer players a real combat challenge.

Related
Honkai: Star Rail Fans Think They've Found a Secret Morse Code Message
Honkai: Star Rail's latest Robin trailer allegedly has Morse code in it, which a fan deciphers and finds a troubling message.

The latest Honkai: Star Rail leak from Firefly Lover disclosed new information about the Apocalyptic Shadow mode, revealing that it will consist of multiple challenges. According to its description, this combat-oriented mode will set players against at least two bosses and a formidable roster of enemies. As in Honkai: Star Rail 's Pure Fiction , Trailblazers will collect scores in the Apocalyptic Shadow to obtain precious rewards. One thing to note is that the difficulty and rewards of the mode won't be affected by the player's Equilibrium Level.

Honkai: Star Rail's Apocalyptic Shadow Mode Rewards

  • 800 Stellar Jades
  • Self-Modeling Resins
  • Xueyi

The Apocalyptic Shadow mode will have its own rules and give bosses some unique traits that could make the combat even harder. Moreover, it will prevent players from performing several actions, such as changing team setup, upgrading units, and consuming potion items. As in Honkai: Star Rail 's Simulated Universe , there will be unique effects in each stage of the Apocalyptic Shadow.

According to the leak, the Apocalyptic Shadow mode will reportedly offer Self-Modeling Resins and at least 800 Stellar Jades, which roughly translate into six pulls. Furthermore, it will give a free copy of the four-star Quantum unit Xueyi , who treads on the Destruction path. It's essential to note that these rewards could change before the launch of the mode.

Honkai: Star Rail version 2.3 will allegedly offer a variety of new content, including events, modes, and units. The next update for HoYoverse's space RPG will give away tens of Special Rail Passes that can be exchanged for Light Cones and playable characters. It will expand the Simulated Universe into a new mode called Ordinary Exploration, which will grant players various rewards. As per the schedule, version 2.3 will arrive later in June.

item.title: Skyrim Player Discovers Neat Shout Detail After 10 Years of Playing
item.description:
Highlights

  • Skyrim players can make their Dragonborn character talk by using the seldomly used Throw Voice shout.
  • Throw Voice shout allows Dragonborn to taunt enemies, adding a humorous element to gameplay.
  • Despite being a long-time player, some may not have known about this shout due to race and gender limitations.

A Skyrim player with nearly ten years of experience in the game has discovered that the Throw Voice shout in the game makes the Dragonborn talk. This detail may have been missed by players who rarely use this particular shout during their Skyrim adventures, or those who play certain character types.

Skyrim is a massive game, and one that continuously surprises players even after years of playing it. From hidden areas to the animated trails of ants crawling around, even those who have spent thousands of hours in Skyrim find something new from time to time. Considering that Skyrim has many shouts for the Dragonborn to choose from, Throw Voice may be one that's a little less utilized, and took at least one player by surprise.

Related
Skyrim Fan Creates Real-Life Box That Requires Lockpicking Skill
A Skyrim fan creates an impressive real-life gift box that includes the Lockpicking mini-game which requires some prior knowledge to open.

Skyrim player KhajiitScrolls shared their discovery of Throw Voice making the Dragonborn talk. Generally, the payer character is limited to grunts, groans, and Dragon language, similar to the rest of Bethesda's mostly silent protagonists . However, Throw Voice works by first uttering the Dragon language to trigger the shout, and then a taunt being spoken in the direction the shout was issued in. The clip demonstrates the player's Khajit Dragonborn taunting with comments like "Hey, Skeever butt!" or "Hey, melon nose!"

Hearing the usually silent protagonist dip into taunts like these has struck several players as funny. It may come as a surprise to some that with nearly ten years of experience a player hadn't seen this. However, it's not only a non-damaging shout that has limited uses, but there are also bugs impacting this particular ability. Elves, Argonians, and female Khajit and Orcs don't actually speak when using this skill. As such, anyone who typically sticks with these races or race and gender may have never experienced this even if they do use the shout regularly.

Will The Elder Scrolls 6 Continue the Legacy of Secrets?

Skyrim is still loved by many players, and with so many mods to try out, there is still a surprisingly large playerbase supporting the game. However, The Elder Scrolls 6 is also on the minds of players who are eagerly waiting to see what Bethesda can do to top Skyrim . Starfield gave players a glimpse of what the company is capable of, and like Skyrim , Starfield contains a number of secrets of its own. With Starfield having only released recently in comparison, it may be some time before the majority of its hidden details are discovered. But it's also a strong indication that Bethesda will be placing plenty of secrets and little-known details into The Elder Scrolls 6 that players will be surprised by for years post-release.
